name: The Mulldoon Legacy
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Jon Ingold. Part one of the Mulldoon series.

name: Tales of the Traveling Swordsman
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Mike Snyder.

name: DC Comics Legends
description: DC Comics Legends is a mobile RPG starring DC's popular comic book characters.

name: Augmented Fourth
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Brian Uri!

name: The Mulldoon Murders
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Jon Ingold. Part two of the Mulldoon series.

name: Coming Out Simulator 2014
description:
A half-true story about half-truths.

You play as a semi-fictional version of me, on a night that changed my life forever. Choose your (my?) words wisely. Every character will remember everything you say -- or don't say -- as you figure out how to approach my (your?) hyper-conservative Asian parents. And if all that seems confusing or awkward... well, that's the gist of coming out as queer, isn't it?

name: Bronze
description: When the seventh day comes and it is time for you to return to the castle in the forest, your sisters cling to your sleeves.

name: Bigfoot Evolution: French Classics
description: Racing game

name: Myriad
description: A musical top-down shooter.

name: Hero Must Die
description: Sin descripción

name: Winter Wally
description: A single-screen platformer in which the player controlls the penguin Percy in his attempt to escape from an maze underground of ice caves he is trapped in. Published by Micro Design aka Solar Software for the Atari 8-bit computers.

name: Tank Attack
description: A single-screen shoot'em up in which two players guide their tanks along the screen and try to blow each other up.

name: Cosmic Fire Birds
description: A single screen shoot'em up written by John P. Shay and published by Solar Software for the Commodore VIC-20.

name: Taiko no Tatsujin Wii: Ketteiban
description: Taiko no Tatsujin Wii: Ketteiban is a rhythm / music game which was released in Japan in 2011.

name: Flappy Defense
description: Fire cannonballs at birds to prevent them from getting through the goal pipes! Get coins to buy Upgrades and Diamonds to buy Items.

name: Treasure Hunter
description: A text adventure published by Solar Software for the Commodore 16.

name: Red Ash
description: A spiritual successor to the Mega Man Legends franchise by Comcept.

name: Injection
description: A programming puzzle game where the player must hack the game's code to progress.

name: Aurora 4x
description: A space based 4x game that has endless possibilities, open ended in terms of design.

name: Gran Text Auto
description: An iPhone game in which the Emoji Grandma texts while driving.

name: Winnie Witch's Superbroom
description: A horizontal scrolling shoot'em up written by John P. Shay and published by Solar Software for the Commodore 16.

name: Horse Isle
description: Horse Isle is a game where players find horses.

name: Re:birth Colony -Lost Azurite-
description:
Five hundred years ago, the 5th star rain plunged the world into a deep winter, forcing humans to flee underground, under the sea or in man-made structures called arcologies. At first they waited for the day when the Earth would return to normal, but soon they lost interest in the outside world and were content living in their miniature peaceful worlds.

The arcology Aquarius was founded as an international research institution on a man-made island, but now it is a segregated city with distinct rich and poor areas. Souji was an orphan living on the edge of the poor area of town. He owed his life to a blue-haired woman who saved him and his sister Ruri, but one day she disappeared. Helpless to save her, Souji vowed to become stronger. One day, a girl appeared before him. She looked exactly like the woman who disappeared and also had the same name – Azurite.

name: The Urinal Game
description: A browser-based quiz game where players must select the 'correct' urinal to use in a number of different scenarios.

name: Spica Adventure
description: A 2005 Arcade action-platformer game developed by Taito. A girl with a versatile umbrella must power through a series of fast-paced stages.

name: Miageta Sora ni Ochiteiku
description: A visual novel developed by Applique.

name: Concerto Note
description:
Shinya is stuck!

He is forced to leave school when he comes back to school after long hospitalization. But one day, he meets his childhood friend, Rito, and she tells him about a new school and an western-style old house. Like this, he comes back to his hometown and meets Wakana, Shirayuki, Seika, and Sayori there. Kind people and new house...

One night, a strange girl appears in front of him and says, "You'll die in ten days..." Her name is Tama and she kindly gives him the power to prevent it. However, this means he borrows luck from her in advance. From that day, various mishaps happen to Shinya and his friends. To stop it, they will need to get rid of other people's misfortunes...

name: Suicide Run
description: A horizontal scrolling shoot'em up in which the player flies a spaceship over the surface of Mars bombing and shooting the rockets and fuel dumps.

name: Odoru? Pokémon Ongakutai
description: Odoru? Pokémon Ongakutai is a rhythm game made to promote the short film Pikachu and the Pokémon Band. The player must tap buttons on the screen in time with falling musical notes, as a Pokémon of their choice dances in the foreground. Racking up a combo will reward the player with bonus time, during which a score multiplier and backup Pokémon dancers appear. Additional Pokémon species may be unlocked as the game is played.

name: Bima-X
description: Bima-X is a mobile fighting game based on the Indonesian/Japanese tokusatsu show, Satria Garuda Bima-X.

name: Pro Yakyuu Famista Returns
description: The Famista series returns to 3DS after a four year drought.

name: Robin to the Rescue
description: A Robin Hood-themed single-screen platformer written by John P. Shay and published by Solar Software for the Commodore 16 and Commodore 64.

name: Mist of the Dark
description: Mist of the Dark is a multiplayer psychological horror game where teams of soldiers battle a monster.

name: Space Freeks
description: A vertical-scrolling shoot'em up written by John P. Shay and published by Solar Software for the Commodore 16.

name: City of Secrets 2
description: City Of Secrets 2 is the cancelled sequel to the original point-and-click adventure game, City Of Secrets.

name: Gunman Clive HD Collection
description: The Gunman Clive HD Collection compiles Gunman Clive 1 and 2 in one package with a new 1080p, 4xAA and 60 frames-per-second finish for Wii U.

name: Ryuki Densyo: Dragoon
description: Sin descripción

name: City of Secrets
description: Sin descripción

name: Space Simulator
description: Space Simulator is a real physics full Solar system space flight simulator game for iOS recreating historical and fictional missions that can be played in both manned and autopilot modes.

name: Shoppy Mart
description: A game in which the player takes the job of a grocery store clerk.

name: Party Ball
description: Party Ball is 2D, ball-based puzzle game where the player bounces a ball - the party ball - around over 40 levels across four worlds to collect cups of cola while dodging various hazards.

name: Common Ground
description: Common Ground is a puzzle solving game that follows the exploits of two silent protagonists as they attempt to navigate through life while grappling with the unique way each views the world.

name: Robbo
description: Robbo is an action puzzle video game designed by Janusz Pelc and published by LK Avalon in 1989. It was originally released in Poland for the Atari XL/XE computers. It was later ported to other computer platforms and also released in the United States as The Adventures of Robbo in 1993.

name: Spellfall
description: A tile based puzzle game for iOS and Android.

name: NinJump Dash
description: A multiplayer racing game for iOS and Android.

name: Capitals
description: A multiplayer word game for iOS and Android.

name: Golfinity
description: An endless golf game for iOS and Android.

name: Letterpad
description: A word puzzle game for iOS.

name: Pet Rescue Saga
description:
Puppies and kittens are stuck between the puzzle blocks in this Pet Rescue Saga adventure and need your help! Hurry and save them from the evil Pet Snatchers!

Match 2 or more blocks of the same color to clear the levels and save the pets. Matching moves are limited so plan carefully to blast as many blocks as possible, solve the puzzles, and save the pets.

name: Arcane Legends
description: Arcane Legends is a cross-platform MMORPG experience, merging gamers from around the world into an epic fantasy realm.

name: Patent Blaster
description: Patent Blaster, a side-scrolling explodey kind of game based on awful patent art come to life. The mission: invalidate those patents using any means necessary.

name: G.G Series: Run & Strike
description: Run & Strike is a racquetball simulator for DSi.

name: The Idolmaster: Shiny Festa - Melodic Disc
description: An entry in the popular idol management series from Bandai Namco. Melodic Disc is a port of the unlocalized PSP game with rhythm gameplay altered for touch and graphical enhancements for iOS devices.

name: 250 Mannin no Kanken: Wii de Tokoton Kanji Nou
description: An educational video game with the to assist users in learning to write Kanji. Because of the complexity of multi-stroke Kanji, the game allows the option to use a Nintendo DS for drawing.

name: G.G Series: Air Pinball Hockey
description:
Is it Air Hockey? Is it Pinball? It's Air Pinball Hockey!!

Enjoy the best of both worlds in this hybrid action table top style game. Use the "Smasher" to strike the puck away from your goal space and into the score bumpers and other targets above. Fulfill the conditions of each stage to advance to the next. If the puck makes it past your Smasher, 1 LIFE is lost. If all LIFE is lost, or the time runs out, the game is over. Every few stages an opponent Smasher appears for a round. Keep your reaction timing ready, aim for your challenger's goal and shoot for the high score!

name: Slaves to Armok: God of Blood
description: A single-player fantasy RPG. The game can also be described as a Roguelike.

name: Inside Out: Thought Bubbles
description: A mobile game based on the Pixar movie, Inside Out.

name: Schoolgirl Tournament Fighting
description: Schoolgirl Tournament Fighting brings many of the characters from the Schoolgirl Fighting series together and adds a tournament mode. Also includes a series first - a different background.

name: Pump It Up: Exceed Portable
description: On 30 November 2006, Pump it Up: Exceed was released for the PSP as "Pump it Up Exceed Portable", exclusively in Korea. This version of the game is rated All by the Korea Media Rating Board. It features the same scrolling shapes as the console/arcade versions of Pump It Up playable by using face buttons of the PSP system.

name: Nobunaga no Yabou 2
description: Nobunaga no Yabou 2 is an enhanced remake of Nobunaga no Yabou DS, which was an enhanced remake of Nobunaga no Yabou: Reppuuden.

name: Nobunaga no Yabou DS
description: Nobunaaga no Yabou DS is an enhanced remake of Nobunaga no Yabou: Reppuuden.

name: Sangokushi 2
description: A Nintendo 3DS remake of Sangokushi 3.

name: Pump It Up Zero Portable
description: A portable rhythm game released on 10/15/2007 that features the same scrolling shapes as the console/arcade versions of Pump It Up playable by using face buttons of the PSP system.

name: Giana Sisters: The Puzzle
description:
Experience Giana Sisters Twisted World in a completely new art of puzzle game. All puzzles are double-sided and show motives from both worlds. The way you play decides if your puzzle changes between the two worlds. 
 
Find the right piece from different piles or puzzle the pieces per drag and drop in the classical mode. Furthermore, in Versus-Mode, players can compete against each other on one device. Who finds more correct pieces within the shortest time, will win the competition. 
 
Giana Sisters The Puzzle offers 32 double-sided puzzles with motives from Twisted World and additionally 32 double-sided artworks from Black Forest Games, accessible by playing successfully.

name: Nobunaga's Ambition: Reppuden
description: The eighth title in the Nobunaga's Ambition series.

name: Seabeard
description: As the sole descendant of the great explorer Seabeard, you must follow in his footsteps by sailing between islands doing quests, gathering a new crew, and rebuilding the ruins of his once-prosperous city.

name: Space Age
description: A space adventure game for iOS and the Mac.

name: Adventure Bar Labyrinth
description: A PlayStation mobile RPG released on July 17, 2013. The player controls Lidia, the owner of a small bar.

name: Big Rig Europe
description: A truck driving game that allows the player to drive European trucks in European locations.

name: Dance! Online
description: An online rhythm game with gameplay similar to Stepmania / Dance Dance Revolution. Players could create their own avatar to dance as and unlock various customizations by playing with others in competitions. The game featured a notable mechanic where if the player didn't dance for a while their avatar would start to gain visible weight.

name: Zombiegal Kawaii
description: A side-scrolling, 2D zombie shooting game presented in a cute anime aesthetic for iOS devices.

name: Magic Meisters
description: A cartoonish fantasy RPG where players work to create their own customized mage.

name: Alcarys Complex
description: A narrative focused, character driven, 2D RPG for the PC presented in a similar style of retro pixel art RPG's of the past.

name: Everybody Dies
description: It starts with a metalhead, Graham, realizing that throwing that shopping cart over the bridge was not the great idea he thought it was. Even if it did get him out of washroom duty at Cost Cutters.

name: Sunset Over Savannah
description:
You're on the last day of your vacation, trying to decide whether to quit your job, and the wonders you uncover as you wander around the beach guide your decision. 
 
A piece of interactive fiction written by Ivan Cockrum.

name: Maison de Maou
description: Sin descripción

name: Suveh Nux
description: A piece of interactive fiction written by David Fisher. You play a magician's servant who gets trapped in your master's vault; you'll need to learn some of his tricks if you want to get out.

name: Walker & Silhouette
description:
Team up with a dashing detective and an iconoclastic flapper to solve absurd and unfathomable crimes in this interactive story - where you control the action just by typing or clicking highlighted words in the text.

A piece of interactive fiction written by C.E.J. Pacian.

name: All Things Devours
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction. Is on the list Interactive Fiction Top 50 of all time (2015 edition).

name: Fail-Safe
description: A short piece of Interactive Fiction written by Jon Ingold.

name: Lash: Local Asynchronous Satellite Hookup
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Paul O'Brian. Is on the list Interactive Fiction Top 50 of all time (2011 edition).

name: Treasures of a Slaver's Kingdom
description:
In the cruel kingdoms north of the Viraxian Empire, a barbarian seeks treasure - and vengeance!  
 
A faux-retro adaptation of a nonexistent 1979 text adventure from an alternate timeline, itself based on a nonexistent 1979 pen-and-paper RPG (a complete scan of which is included).

name: Worlds Apart
description: For over 20 years, I dreamed about an alternate universe I called the Higher World. For three of those years, I poured almost all of my creative energy into a novel-length story set in that universe. Worlds Apart is the result. But it is not a novel in the traditional sense of the word. It is an interactive tale in which you play the leading part, solving problems and learning about yourself along the way.

name: Shrapnel
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Adam Cadre. Is on the list Interactive Fiction Top 50 of all time (2015 edition).

name: For a Change
description: For a Change is a thought provoking text adventure game known for its ability to challenge players' perceptions and perspectives, originally written for the 5th Interactive Fiction Competition.

name: Rameses
description: Rameses Alexander Moran is a self-proclaimed "shy, indecisive, and uncharismatic" boy living at an Irish boarding school, which he has only contempt for. He reminisces about his childhood friend Daniel Maguire in a dream as they playfully shout profanities at each other on a busy railway station platform. He awakes on his bunkbed in a four-bed dormitory.

name: Metamorphoses
description: You wake to stillness. The hammering, banging, and shouting that kept you awake half the night are gone. The air is cold, and something smells burnt. Your master's experiments must be finished, but with what result? A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Emily Short.

name: Endless, Nameless
description:
You are a yet another brave adventurer set upon the quest to slay the mighty dragon that is threatening the village! Following the questing traditon, you decide to start your search for the dragon in the local tavern! What makes this quest different? It takes place on the worldz best BBS! hehehe!!! 
 
A piece of interactive fiction by Adam Cadre.

name: Their Angelical Understanding
description:
I train to fight angels in a monastery by the sea.

An interactive fiction piece by Porpentine.

name: Make It Good
description:
The call comes through. Of all the dicks; you get the call, sitting in the front seat of your car, hands shaking on the steering wheel. An urgent call; but all you were thinking of was the bottle in the liquor store and so that's where you went first. 
 
Now you're pulled up outside the house. The rear mirror's showing two steely eyes. You adjust your hat, stiffen up your collar and grab your badge off the dash. Here goes. You've one last chance so... MAKE IT GOOD

name: Kerkerkruip
description: Kerkerkruip is a short-form roguelike in the interactive fiction medium, featuring meaningful tactical and strategic depth, innovative game play, zero grinding, and a sword & sorcery setting that does not rehash tired clichés.

name: The King of Shreds and Patches
description: The King of Shreds and Patches is a novel-length work of interactive fiction. In it you will explore an historically accurate recreation of Elizabethan London, circa 1603, interact with some fascinating characters both historical and fictional, and if you are clever and lucky, thwart an occult conspiracy that threatens to bring down the entire city - or worse.

name: De Baron
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Victor Gijsbers. Winner of the Spring Thing 2006.

name: Cryptozookeeper
description:
Marrow is delicious but that's not why you're here. You're supposed to pick up a single jar of alien bone jelly, which of course can't exist and doesn't exist, so you've convinced yourself that transporting it is no crime. Getting worked up about such nonsense would be like fretting about mermaids getting caught in tuna nets, and you've got other fur-bearing fish to fry.

A piece of interactive fiction written by Robb Sherwin.

name: Blue Chairs
description: A surrealist piece of interactive fiction by Chris Klimas about a man who is offered a hallucinatory drug at a party.

name: The Elysium Enigma
description:
It was meant to be a routine visit on behalf of the imperial government, just to remind the settlers that the Empire hadn't forgotten them, and if you stick rigidly to the letter of your orders and refuse to use either your eyes or your initiative that's all it'll be. But with an interstellar war brewing in the background, you'd be wise not to take anything for granted.

A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Eric Eve.

name: First Draft of the Revolution
description: An interactive epistolary story written by Emily Short and Liza Daly, in which the reader acts by revising the letters exchanged by its characters. Part three in the Lavori d'Aracne series.

name: Damnatio Memoriae
description: 14 AD. Agrippa Postumus, grandson of the recently-deceased Augustus, tries to avoid death at the hands of the next emperor, Tiberius. At his disposal: a couple of old manuscripts, a lamp, and a recalcitrant slave. And a powerful knowledge of the Art of Venus Genetrix, of course—the magic eventually known as the Lavori d'Aracne. A work of interactive fiction written by Emily Short.

name: Savoir-Faire
description: The beautiful life is always damned, they say. As for you, you've overexpended yourself: fifteen years of prominence, champagne, carriage rides in the Tuileries, having your name whispered behind manicured hands, getting elegant ladies out of elegant fixes - and you're in debt. Bound by oath and honor to a pack of scoundrels. Your father, old peasant that he was, could have warned you against their type. A piece of interactive fiction written by Emily Short.

name: Coloratura
description:
Stolen away by apathetic Blind Ones, your only desire is to return to your Cellarium and the Song of the Universe. They should understand. You shall make them to understand. 
 
A piece of interactive fiction written by Lynnea Glasser.

name: Hunger Daemon
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Sean M. Shore. Winner of the 20th Annual Interactive Fiction Competition (2014).

name: Andromeda Dreaming
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Joey Jones. Part of the Andromeda Series created by Marco Innocenti.

name: Andromeda Awakening
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Marco Innocenti. The first part of the Andromeda Series.

name: Andromeda Apocalypse
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Marco Innocenti. Part 2 of the Andromeda Series. Winner of the 18th Annual Interactive Fiction Competition (2012).

name: Andromeda Ascending
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Truthcraze. Part of the Andromeda Series created by Marco Innocenti.

name: Rover's Day Out
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Jack Welch and Ben Collins-Sussman. Winner of the 15th Annual Interactive Fiction Competition (2009).

name: Taco Fiction
description: You are in your car, with a gun in your pocket, going back and forth with yourself about whether you should get moving immediately, or take some time to think about your situation. Some of the wording, and the fact that the game is subtitled "an interactive heist", make it not unreasonable to infer that you are gearing up for a robbery. A piece of interactive fiction written by Ryan Veeder.

name: Aotearoa
description:
The Fish of Māui. The Land of the Long Cloud. Aotearoa. An entire continent of untamed wilds, and the last place on Earth where dinosaurs still roam. If only you'd come ashore under better circumstances...

A piece of interactive fiction written by Matt Wigdahl.

name: Violet
description: Calm down. All you have to do is write a thousand words and everything will be fine. And you have all day, except it's already noon. A piece of interactive fiction written by Jeremy Freese.

name: Floatpoint
description: It is night on this side of the planet. Settled areas are lit: a jagged crescent in the tropics, lining the inland sea. The bright splatter along the top of the curve is Tanhua, as bright from space as New York. The north continent is darker, sprinkled finely with small lights, where the failing climate makes it hard to survive a winter. And the northernmost point, almost lost on the slope of Mt. Cordia, is the original Aleheart Colony, where the first settlers from Earth landed. It is your destination as well. A piece of interactive fiction written by Emily Short.

name: Vespers
description: A piece of interactive fiction written by Jason Devlin.

name: Slouching Towards Bedlam
description: Enter a steampunk adventure set in a London that might have been. The year is 1885. Bedlam Hospital still stands in Moorsfield, a decaying shell used to house the poor and the hopeless. Steam-driven mechanical wonders roam the streets. Gear-wheeled analytical engines spin out reams of thought onto punched paper tapes. And in the darkness – in the alleys and the side shops – hide secrets. A piece of interactive fiction written by Star Foster and Daniel Ravipinto.

name: The Edifice
description: Something new in your everyday hunter-gatherer routine: where did this strange edifice come from? Dare you enter and explore the secrets of this... thing, or do you try to face your enemies? Like you have a choice.

name: All Roads
description: Venice. The tight winding alleys and long dirty canals. Easy to become lost here, where every street emerges somewhere unexpected. In the central square a scaffold has been erected for your neck, and if only you can escape for long enough you might survive, but in this city all roads lead back to Piazza San Marco and the Hanging Clock.

name: Delusions
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by C. E. Forman. Came third in the 2nd Annual IF Competition, in 1996.

name: The Mind Electric
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Jason Dyer. Came second in the Inform division of the First Annual IF Competition, in 1995.

name: The One That Got Away
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Leon Lin. Came third in the TADS division of the First Annual IF Competition, in 1995.

name: Uncle Zebulon's Will
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Magnus Olsson. Winner of the TADS division in the First Annual IF Competition, in 1995.

name: Toonesia
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Jacob Weinstein. Came second in the TADS division of the First Annual IF Competition, in 1995.

name: 5-nin no Koi Prince: Himitsu no Keiyaku Kekkon
description: A otome game for Vita, iOS, and Android.

name: Cube Life: Island Survival
description: A block building open-world survival game originally for the Wii U, later ported to a variety of systems.

name: Attacking Zegeta
description: Indie platformer.

name: The Magic Toyshop
description: A piece of Interactive Fiction written by Gareth Rees. Came third in the Inform division of the First Annual IF Competition, in 1995.

name: School Wars ~All Series Pack Honpen & Sotsugyou Sensen~
description: A bundle of both School Wars games.

name: Sakura Fantasy: Chapter 1
description: An entry in the Sakura franchise, this time with a female protagonist.

name: Musicology
description: The player takes the control of an independent record label. They must manage artists and bands.

name: Fragmentum
description: Fragmentum is a vehicle builder/real time strategy game. Players design units which are then built and used to fight in skirmishes.

name: Ouroboros: The Sacrifice
description: Go home or die trying.

name: Stingray
description: An idle game based on games like Candybox and Cookie Clicker.

name: Super Skeleman
description: A freeware platformer inspired by 3D Mario gameplay, Super Skeleman is the story of the titular skeleton in search of five Runes that will let him unlock a mysterious door.

name: SMS Racing
description: A game about the thrill of texting and driving.

name: Harvest OverRay
description: Japanese Visual Novel about a student in an Augmented Reality world.

name: The Little Vikings
description: Browser based online game developed by Micazook and available on Facebook and Hooqt.

name: Dark Raid: Bot Wars
description: A hybrid of first-person and third-person shooting from Vector Games.

name: Mission Mars
description: The player has to navigate a spaceship through the caverns of Mars in this action game published by Solar Software.

name: Stellar Frontier
description: Space game by Stardock.

name: SpikeDislike 3
description: Dislike spikes a third time.

name: Munch Time 2
description: Time to get munch'n!

name: Citizen
description: A lost ex- nasa space marine must meet his family by bypassing the corrupt dictatorship, no freedom of movement. a puzzle adventure game exclusive to Windows 10 and Xbox ONE

name: Bear Winter
description: A match 3 game where you try to survive the winter while hunting bears.

name: Meteorite
description: A 2D multi-directional shoot'em up written by John P. Shay and published by Solar Software under the name Asteroyds for the Commodore VIC-20 and later under the name Meteorite for the Commodore 16.

name: Being Andrew Plotkin
description: A piece of interactive fiction written by J. Robinson Wheeler, featuring IF luminary Andrew Plotkin in a parody of the movie Being John Malkovich.

name: Invasion 2000 A.D.
description: A shoot'em up based on Space Invaders, where the player controls a spacecraft at the bottom of the screen moving left or right, destroying a wave of aliens above descending slowly in formation.

name: Puramai Wars
description: Sin descripción

name: Icebreaker: The Text Adventure
description: An Interactive Fiction interpretation of Andy Looney's arcade game Icebreaker, created by Andrew Plotkin.

name: Lord of Vermilion Arena
description: Square Enix's first MOBA game, based on successful Lord of Vermilion franchise

name: Beyblade: Metal Masters
description: A Nintendo DS entry in the Beyblade series.

name: Zhu Zhu Puppies
description: A Nintendo DS exclusive game in the Zhu Zhu Pets franchise.

name: Personal Fitness for Women
description: A personal trainer for the Nintendo DS aimed towards women.

name: Inhumane
description: The first available piece of Interactive Fiction created by Andrew Plotkin, being a a parody of Infocom’s Infidel.

name: Praser 5
description:
Wander around. Puzzles will be posed. Eventually you win.

A work of interactive fiction by Andrew Plotkin, recreating one he originally made in 1989.

name: A Change in the Weather
description:
Walking away from a picnic, you are suddenly caught in a country storm. You must protect a bridge from being destroyed.

A game by Andrew Plotkin he describes as his "first serious work of interactive fiction".

name: Lists and Lists
description: Interactive Fiction created by Andrew Plotkin being a fusion between a game and a programming tutorial.

name: So Far
description: Interactive Fiction created by Andrew Plotkin with unforgiving puzzles. A theatrical performance leads to a long journey.

name: Hunter, in Darkness
description: An interactive fiction story by Andrew Plotkin depicting a tense and harrowing chase in a claustrophobic cavern setting.

name: The Dreamhold
description: Fantasy Interactive Fiction created by Andrew Plotkin, as both a game and an introduction to the genre.

name: Tsumiki: Block Drop Mania
description: A puzzle game for the Nintendo DS.

name: Dual Transform
description: Interactive Fiction created by Andrew Plotkin, where the objective is to escape a virtual room.

name: Gibson Hyperdrive
description: Race for as long as you can in this motorcycle parkour game from Doomlaser.

name: The Matter of the Monster
description:
You stagger up to its lair. Blue sand drags at your feet.
Your hands don't tremble — well, much — as you ready your new weapon. Your voice doesn't quaver (hardly at all) as you shout out the words you were taught.
One, two! Dive and roll! Jump! Attack!
...That wasn't so hard, was it? You defeated the monster, and it's not even bedtime yet.

A work of interactive fiction by Andrew Plotkin.

name: The Space Under the Window
description: Interactive Fiction created by Andrew Plotkin, being more of an experiment than usual.

name: Heroes & Titans: Battle Arena
description: Heroes & Titans is a mobile RPG. Level up heroes and challenge others in arena.

name: Cinderella Free Fall
description: A match puzzle game based on the 2015 live action remake of Disney's 1950 classic animated film.

name: Veecaloid Pop
description: The object of Veecaloid is to gather various objects littered across the screen, themed to either a Magical Girl or pop idol. The main character is a vocaloid based on (and voiced by) voice actress/singer Cristina Vee.

name: Alnory
description: Alnory is a SRPG from developer Avavi.

name: HeroBound: Spirit Champion
description: Herobound is a mobile virtual reality action/adventure game where players control a young goblin in a quest to save the world.

name: Ore ni Hatarakette Iwaretemo Tori
description: A management RPG about a shut-in who hires adventurers to go on quests for him.

name: Tour de France 2015
description: The 2015 edition of the offical Tour de France video game franchise.

name: Cold Iron

description:
Hayato has yearned for a heart-throbbing romance for a long time, but instead is bored wasting away time every day. He wishes to fall in love like in an eroge, but everyone around him just makes fun of him for it. But that’s what every guy wants, right? Is it really so wrong to want such a relationship?

In the middle of November, a small chance appeared when he was asked to work part-time at the popular bakery restaurant, La Pivoine. Finding himself in a situation he never imagined being in, he thought to break free of his current norm. He agreed to work there and acquainted himself with the staff: Sora, his childhood friend who has no interest in falling in love; Shiho, the store manager whose lover is her job; Moemi, the moodmaker part-timer who treasures her family over all; Arisa, his underclassman who hasn’t found her ideal partner; and, Ayumi, his cousin who is still early for love.

The first game under the new Pulltop Air label. A heart-warming visual novel about a protagonist who suddenly moves to the countryside to live with his sister-in-law once he learns of her existence.

Takefumi Morioka’s mother has died a long time ago and his father is living somewhere abroad. One day he receives a letter addressed to his father, from a girl who claims to be his daughter. With the sudden appearance of his “sister” he sets off to meet her without hesitation. And once there he finds the girl Yuzu Yaehara at a remodeled watermill located in a beautiful rural town. She has been living a solitary life since the passing of her grandmother. But now with Takefumi as her guardian he intents to listen to any of her requests, deepening their bonds as they start their sudden sibling life.

name: Dekaron
description: Dekaron initially released as "2Moons," is a free-to-play MMORPG known for its intense and immersive gameplay. Set in a dark fantasy world, the game distinguishes itself with a robust and unique PvP (Player vs Player) system that features everything from solo duels to massive guild battles, offering various modes that cater to different styles of combat and strategic play. Despite its age, Dekaron has maintained a dedicated fan base, thanks in part to its challenging dungeons, extensive skill trees, and the frequent updates that keep the game dynamic and engaging. This enduring popularity is a testament to its well-crafted world and the thrilling PvP encounters that provide a deeply competitive and rewarding experience for players.

Unfortunately, they are actually the prices from Fasan Kingdom who are under the spell Players can get to know Matheus, Alfred, Lucia, and Erik, the four brothers, and help them break the spell (You could also end up with her childhood friend)

Stride is an extreme sport in which teams made up of six people run through town.

"You", or Sakurai Nana (default name changeable) became drawn to Stride after watching a web video depicting a Stride match with Hounan Senior High Academy. Wholeheartedly wanting to play Stride, Nana enrolled into Hounan Academy.

What awaited Nana were other boys who were to Stride the same way she was. As you grow as a "Relationer", the leader of the team, win the "End of Summer" Eastern Japan Tournament alongside your team mates! School life, your club family, close friendship, rivalry, matches... What awaits at the end of this all?

A story about experiencing your once-in-a-lifetime youth at full speed. Youth x Sports Club. That is "Prince of Stride".

Avalon is the longest running online roleplaying game in the world at 25 years (a world record). It is from Avalon that numerous contemporary genre-defining features such as cooldowns, player run organisations such as guilds, and the foundation of skill-driven player vs player combat originate.

An online text-based RPG ahead of its time ever since it began in 1989 as the first multiplayer roleplaying game online. Avalon is a fair meritocracy. You may quicken your pace but you cannot achieve excellence without deserving it and excellence in any area takes time.

name: Kita he.: Diamond Dust
description:
Kita e. ~Diamond Dust~ is a visual novel developed by RED.

The story is about six different girls from different lifestyles living on Hokkaidō in Japan. They each live in a different city on the island. Each girl believes in a myth of snow turning into diamond dust, and if one makes a wish on the diamond dust, their wish is 100% guaranteed to come true. Another myth about diamond dust is that if a boy and girl meet under the dust, they're guaranteed happiness and marriage later in life. Each of the six girls have some stubborn moments and awkward stages in their lives, but looking into themselves and others will help them get back on their feet. When these six girls meet, their lives will change dramatically for the better as the snow begins to fall.

name: Sugar Coat Freaks
description: Sugar Coat Freaks is a visual novel developed by Littlewitch.

name: Rondo Leaflet
description: Rondo Leaflet is a visual novel developed by Littlewitch.

name: Tap Sports Baseball 2015
description: A one touch free-to-play baseball game from Glu.

name: Starship Empire
description: Starship Empire is an intense PvP-filled space MMO where you not only lead your ship into epic battles, but manage the entire crew inside!

name: Yo-kai Sangokushi
description:
Yo-kai Sangokushi is a turn-based tactical role-playing game developed by Koei Tecmo and published by Level-5.
It's a crossover between the Yo-kai Watch and Romance of the Three Kingdoms series.

name: Taiko no Tatsujin: Rhythmic Adventure 1
description: Don-chan leaves the past behind for a great adventure, that transcends time and space, to the future! Warp to different eras to stop the bad guys from destroying history!

name: Tethernum
description: A puzzle game where players attempt to convert all squares, across two interlinked grids, into the same color.

name: The Message
description: An interactive Fiction game set after humanity's first contact with extraterrestrial life, made by Jeremy Lonien and Dominik Johann for Fuck This Jam 2012.

name: Armada Online
description: Developers of the original Armada acquired the rights to the name and are now working on an online game called... Armada Online

name: Operation Frog
description: An educational game designed to replace or supplement real-life frog dissection in classrooms.

name: Hana no No ni Saku Utakata no
description:
Michitaka is able to see the marks left by others. The paths they’ve followed and the objects they’ve touched are all tinged with colours that are unique to each individual. Even though it is useful at times, it is mostly a troublesome ability. 
 
Before his second year, his father asked him if he wished to live by himself at the old-fashioned Ouka-sou, which was managed by his cousins. Since he had always wanted to live alone, he jumped at the chance. However, when he arrived with great excitement, he was welcomed by the silver-haired Ouka. He did not notice any colours emanating from her. 
 
“I am what you call… a ghost.” 
 
Together with his cousins, childhood friends and various upperclassmen and underclassmen from his school, the most unforgettable days have begun this spring.

name: Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu Black
description: A Nintendo DS entry in the popular Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu semi-truck racing franchise.

name: Shin Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu
description: A PlayStation 2 entry in the Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu semi-truck racing franchise.

name: Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu: Otoko Hanamichi Yume Roman
description: The first PlayStation 2 entry in the Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu franchise.

name: Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu 2: Otoko Jinsei Yume Ichiro
description: Released alongside "Art Camion: Geijutsuden" on the same day, "Bakusou Dokotora Densetsu 2 - Otoko Jinsei Yume Ichiro" is generally seen as the proper 2nd installment of the series. This sequel introduces numerous changes to modes and gameplay, accompanied by an entirely new soundtrack and enhanced graphics quality.

name: Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu: Otoko Ippiki Yume Kaidoi
description: Bakusou Dekotora Densetsu: Otoko Ippiki Yume Kaidoi is a racing video game developed and released by Human Entertainment, released on June 25, 1998 in Japan. This game puts you in the role of a truck driver in Japan, transporting cargo and competing in illegal races against other trucks.

name: Finger Derpy
description: Horse racing game with intentionally frustrating controls.

name: Temple of Yog
description: A Wii U-exclusive roguelike which displays the regular world on the TV and a shadow world on the GamePad screen.

name: Abunai Koi no Sousashitsu: Eternal Happiness
description: A sequel to Otome game from PSP called "Abunai Koi ☆ no Sousashitsu" released for the PlayStation Vita.

name: Rising Angels: The Red Rose
description: A sci-fi visual novel and the prequel to Rising Angels: Reborn.

name: Girlish Grimoire Littlewitch Romanesque
description: As Domino, you must mentor Aria and Kaya in their training to become witches, mastering the magical arts. Take them to the classroom to grow the skills required to master powerful spells. Send them on quests to test their progress and show them the dangers that exist in the world.

name: Quartett!
description: Quartett! is an adult visual novel game.

name: The Sword of Asumi
description: The Sword of Asumi is a visual novel developed by AJTilley.

name: Excave II: Wizard of the Underworld
description: Excave II is a classic JRPG style dungeon hack and slash game wherein players take the role of one of two adventurers, tasked with returning order to a progressively more chaotic city.

name: Venus Project
description: Venus Project is an idol training game that uses a card and command input system. Players partake in versus-style performance battles in order to win popularity as they support the growth of their budding idols.

name: amiibo Tap: Nintendo's Greatest Bits
description: Tap any amiibo to unlock brief gameplay highlights of classic Nintendo games. A free title for Wii U.

name: DrumMania V8
description: Released on March 28th, 2006, Drummania V8 is the 8th addition to the Drummania V series of arcade drum rhythm games released by Konami under their Bemani series. This is the final version of the Drummania V series to be produced.

name: Clover Day's: Making for Happiness
description: Clover Day's: Making for Happiness is a port of the 2014 visual novel for the PlayStation Vita.

name: Shin Mahjong
description: A Mahjong game for the Super Famicom published by Konami. It features cameos from famous historical figures.

name: Steed
description: Steed is a ARGP where the horse is the hero. It was made in the Amnesia Fortnight 2014 of Double Fine.

name: Splotches
description: Splotches is a colorful, splattery puzzle game littered with paint and explosions.

name: Mnemonic
description: Mnemonic is a noire adventure made in the Amnesia Fortnight 2014 of Double Fine.

name: Little Pink Best Buds
description: Little Pink Best Buds is a thriller exploration adventure made in the Amnesia Fortnight 2014 of Double Fine.

name: Happy Song
description: Happy song is a music making game made in the Amnesia Fortnight 2012 of Double Fine.

name: Rising Angels: Fates
description: A visual novel following investigator Natalie Puccile throughout the galaxy.

name: Dear Leader
description: Dear Leader is a game inspired by 'Papers Please' and was made during the Amnesia Fortnight 2014 of Double Fine.

name: How Do You Do It?
description: How Do You Do It? puts players in the role of an 11-year-old girl whose mother has just stepped out for an errand. The girl immediately grabs her dolls and furtively attempts to figure out how sex works using these plastic surrogates.

developers.name: Nina Freeman, Emmett Butler, Decky Coss, Joni Kittaka

name: Tasogare no Sinsemilla
description:
Minakami is a small village with mountains surrounding it. With tradition and interpersonal relation still rooted strongly, a big shrine became the center of local activity. There, a legend about a Tennyo and her robe exists.

A university student, Minagami Kousuke, returns to his hometown which he never visited after an incident involving him and his family.
He reunites with his once estranged family and friends, and also meets some new ones: Shouko, his cousin who is somewhat cold to him; Iroha, his childhood friend who welcomes him dearly; and Ginko, a mysterious woman who seems to know him in the past.
Kousuke spends his time peacefully while working part-time job and trying to improve his relationship with them.

——But one day, a monster called Yamawaro breaks that peace.

The monster attacks Kousuke and he gets hospitalized.
Even though he has no major injuries, he notices irregularities surrounding him.

What is the true nature of the monster? Is it related to the Tennyo legend? Why can't Kousuke remember the past? And who is this mysterious woman, Ginko?
There is something more to this village than what meets the eyes.

Suddenly, Kousuke's younger sister Sakuya comes to visit him...

name: Paranormal Pursuit: The Gifted One
description: A hidden object adventure about child protection officer Samantha Evans who must keep a psychic child safe from nefarious pursuers wishing to use his gift for their own evil ends.

name: PacMax Classics
description: Compilation of Pac-Man clones.

name: Barbie Superpack: Secret Agent / Groovy Games
description: Barbie Secret Agent and Barbie Groovy Games on a single cartridge.

name: Transparent Machines
description: A stealth puzzle action/adventure game coming soon to Windows 10 & Xbox One.

name: Fantasy Slots: Adventure Slots and Games
description: Slot play with either 3 or 5 reels. Earn money to purchase things for your hotel suite.

name: Monster Tale Ultimate
description: An enhanced remaster of Monster Tale (originally for Nintendo DS) coming to the 3DS eShop with scaled back backtracking, improved visuals, stereoscopic 3D and an option to switch between the original chiptune music and new orchestrated score.

name: Gat Life: Boyfriend Bar
description: A gay dating sim where the physical aspects of romance are more family friendly.

name: Naut
description:
Is there life on Mars?

Wander around, drive through the desert, hear what the cosmos has to tell you.

name: Balloon Diaspora
description: A 3D point-and-click adventure game with music by Oliver Blank. Explore a foreign culture, make new friends and ride through the clouds in a hot air balloon.

name: Hummingbird Mind
description: Hummingbird Mind is a short visual novel / interactive story about distraction, daydreaming, and working from home.

name: Dog and Bone Are Friends
description: Puzzle platformer about a dog and a skeleton.

name: Beulah and the Hundred Birds
description: An exploration platformer about girl in a valley who rides a giant bird.

name: A House in California
description: ‘A House in California’ is a surreal, narrative game about four characters who bring a house to life. These four characters are based on relatives of mine (two grandmothers and two great-grandmothers). The game is inspired aesthetically by Mystery House, developed in 1980 by Roberta & Ken Williams. But whereas Mystery House is a mystery story about greed and murder, A House in California is more like an Imagist poem about family and memory.

name: Yuki Koi Melt
description: Cute anime girls in winter! Can this all virgin roster melt your heart? Find out in this multiple route comedy Visual Novel from Frontwing.

name: Halo Online
description:
Halo Online was a free-to-play multiplayer-only Halo game that was tested exclusively in Russia.

The game was cancelled on August 24, 2016, when the developer, Saber Interactive, announced that "the current form of Halo Online will not be released." The reason they gave for the cancellation was that Microsoft had "failed to [make] decisions on the future of the project."

name: Super Naxat Open: Golf de Shoubu da! Dorabocchan
description: A Super Famicom golf game featuring characters from Naxat's Dorabocchan franchise, best known in the US as Spike McFang.

name: Clay Champ
description: Allied licensed this Clay Shooting game from Namco in 1979

name: Derby Jockey: Kishou he no Michi
description: A 1994 horseracing game for the Super Famicom. It was followed with a sequel in 1995.

name: Driver: Speedboat Paradise
description: The Driver franchise hits the water.

name: Yuugen Gaisha Brave Company
description: Yuugen Gaisha Brave Company is a strategy game, released only in Japan.

name: NBA All Net
description: Become the ultimate NBA team manager by collecting, managing, and customizing a roster of your favorite players! Do you have what it takes to become a legendary NBA manager?

name: Shinsouban Okashi na Shima no Peter Pan: Sweet Never Land
description: A remake with with bonus scenes and updated art.

name: Yorbie
description: A 3D twin stick shooter where Yorbie the robot must take on the forces of the evil Dr. Zox.

name: Gems With Friends
description: Gems with Friends is a free, tile-matching video game for mobile devices by Zynga. It's the sixth entry in Zynga's 'With Friends' series of games with a global release. The game was taken offline on March 26, 2018.

name: It's Walky! Resurrection
description: It's Walky! Resurrection is based on David Willis' webcomic "It's Walky!"

name: Stampede Run
description:
Dodge bulls and challenge your friends. Complete achievements to earn new boosts and power your way up the leaderboards. The bulls are ready to run anywhere you go, with offline play now available. SMASH through snowmen, presents and barrels!

The game was taken offline on April 20, 2015.

name: Lava Rush
description: Sin descripción

name: Heartbeats: A Galactic Requiem
description: Heartbeats is a 10 level puzzle short story made from text, 2D graphics and unforgiving old school puzzle gameplay.

name: Airborn: Piño's Journey
description: Airborn is 3D action adventure game that has been in development since 2006 by artists & programmers from several major studios.

name: Ultra Car: Obsticon Onslaught
description: A simplistic shoot-'em-up by cartoonist David Willis, featuring the character that would eventually become the basis for the character of Ultra Car in his webcomics, It's Walky! and Shortpacked!

name: Anekouji Naoko to Gin'iro no Shinigami
description: Sin descripción

description: The third sequential version of the popular Japanese board game from Enix.

name: Itadaki Street: Gorgeous King
description: The sole release of Itadaki Street for the original PlayStation.

name: Happy Margaret!
description: Sin descripción

name: Wiz Anniversary Funta! feat. Ruru
description: Sin descripción

name: Jewel Match 2
description: More jewels to match!

name: Otome Riron to Sono Shuuhen: Ecole de Paris
description: Sin descripción

name: Tokyo Necro
description:
Nemo ante mortem beatus.
"Nobody can be called happy before their death."
(Herodotus, "Histories")

- The era of "Necromancers" has come.

The protagonists, Kibanohara Ethica and Nagaoka Souun, are young "Private Special Living Dead Stalkers". By practicing a special kind of martial art called "Close Quarter Armed Martial Arts", both of them have achieved great heights in their career.
Out on a mission one day, Souun becomes involved in a fierce battle and meets a young girl. Remembering nothing but her name, "Hougyou Ilia", she has become the target of a mysterious group of necromancers.
The ice-cold Tokyo of gunpowder smoke, living dead, crime and cybernetics. Now begins the battle of the living dead stalkers and the heroine with their lives at stake.

name: Fatal Escape
description: Fatal Escape is a fast-paced platformer starring geometric shapes.

name: Voyage of the Starship Lexicon
description: Sin descripción

name: Nevergrind
description: NeverGrind is set in the world of Vandamor, a land inhabited by orcs, giants and dragons! Battle against the dark forces that have sewn chaos and destruction throughout the realm! Embark on your journey to unveil and crush the forces of evil, fighting battles and hunting for treasure along the way!

name: Utherous
description: Utherous is a sandbox MMORPG that incorporates RTS building and NPC systems.

name: Lemming Dynasty
description:
Lemming Dynasty is an endless arcade bouncer for iOS and Android.
The idea is to save the Lemmings by bouncing them to the other side. Miss one Lemming and you’ll see what happens at the bottom of the pit. The game has no advertisement or in-app-purchases and it’s free!

name: Agent Alice
description: A hidden object game for mobile devices.

name: ToQger Maze Game
description: A mobile game based on the 38th iteration of Super Sentai, Ressha Sentai ToQger

name: Kuroko no Basket: Mirai he no Kizuna
description: The third entry in the Kuroko no Baske video game series.

name: The Enforcer
description: A platformer written by Gavin Raeburn in which the player takes the role of a robot who enters a series of scrolling underground caverns to dispose of all the denizens.

name: Dungeons of Aledorn
description: A spiritual successor to old-school RPG / Dungeon Crawlers, combining a tactical turn-based combat system, first-person exploration, and hardcore stat and skill balancing.

name: Rise of Champions
description: A PvP centric turn-based strategy MMO by Frozen Torch.

name: Horror Stories
description: A co-op horror game.

name: Death Crimson 2: Meranito no Saidan
description: Sequel to Death Crimson, light gun game released to the SEGA Dreamcast. Japanese Exclusive.

name: Super Zugan: Hakotenjou kara no Shoutai
description: A Super Famicom comedic Mahjong game with an overarching storyline. It was followed by a sequel a few years later.

name: Hiouden: Mamono-tachi to no Chikai
description: A PC-98 RPG from Wolf Team with an isometric perspective. It later saw an enhanced Super Famicom port.

name: White Space
description: Bounty hunting in a spacecraft on procedurally generated planets featuring aerial combat.

name: Downtown Dodgeball Da yo: Zenin Shuugou!!
description:
Former Technos Japan developers Miracle Kidz release a Super Dodgeball-inspired game.
The physical release of the game came with a ROM patch for Downtown Nekketsu Monogatari EX that added many more features.

name: Kunio-kun no Nekketsu Dodgeball Allstars!!
description: Kunio-kun no Nekketsu Dodgeball Allstars!! for mobile devices gives players the opportunity to play as over 100 characters in the Kunio-Kun series.

name: Harukanaru Toki no Naka de 5
description: A PlayStation Portable exclusive entry in the Harukanaru Toki no Naka de series.

name: Zorro: Quest for Justice
description: The swordsman returns again for a bout on the DS.

name: DraKoI
description:
A boy-meets-girl story in a world under attack by dragons.

Dra†KoI was released along side a Fandisc by Nitroplus, which includes "Dra+Koi", "Kaigen Seito" and "Nitro Wars".

name: Orly's Draw-A-Story
description: An educational game in which the player illustrates portions of a narrated story.

name: Aima
description: A Korean MMORPG by Nexon.

name: World Class Rugby 2: Kokunai Gekitou-hen '93
description: A Super Famicom exclusive rugby game and the sequel to World Class Rugby.

name: Hisshou 777 Fighter: Pachi-Slot Ryuuguu Densetsu
description: A pachi-slot (slot machine) simulator game for the Super Famicom. The title refers to the mythical Sea Dragon Palace of Japanese folklore.

name: Tales of the Odd: Brain Hotel
description: Based on the Comic: Tales of the Odd, Ed Arnold has the misfortune of delivering a package to the Brain Hotel on the eve of their annual super-villain convention and stumbles across a sinister plot that threatens the lives of countless hotel patrons!

name: Destruct
description: A horizontal scrolling shoot'em up written by Clark John Denham and published by The Power House for the Commodore 64. In a battle-armoured jet suit the player fends off enemy aircraft and guided missiles whilst avoiding deadly landscape features.

name: Drawn to Kill
description: An archery game for iOS.

name: UFOs Love Cows
description: A free to play game developed by Double Helix Games about a UFO abducting cows.

name: Oquonie
description: A textless adventure/puzzle game in which the player, a disgruntled rabbit, must exit a superstructure that houses other disgruntled animals in an effort to discover how, what, and why you are.

name: Darkside
description: A sci-fi based shoot'em'up in which you pilot the spaceship X52-Arklight and fight back a host of alien hostiles who have invaded the outer territories of our solar system.

name: Warring States Tactics
description: A turn-based strategy game set during the Warring States period of Ancient China.

name: The Berks Trilogy
description: Compilation containing three games from the Berks saga by Jon Williams.

name: Cosmic Commando
description: A 1st person shooter in space that was released under three different names("Cosmic Commando", "Space Pirate" and "Star Commander") for various 8-bit homecomputers.

name: Antipole DX
description: A remake of the XBLIG/DSiWare game Antipole for download via Wii U and Nintendo 3DS.

name: Berks 3: They're Angry!
description: The final game in the Berks saga

name: The Fabulous Screech
description: A short point-and-click game by Jonas Kyratzes set in the Lands of Dream universe.

name: Chaos Ride
description: A fast paced, futuristic arcade racer.

name: Sacred Line Genesis
description: Sacred Line Genesis is a visual novel adaptation of the 2013 computer game Sacred Line.

name: Sacred Line
description: Sacred Line is a first-person horror game for computers, from Sasha Darko.

name: Major Blink: Berks 2
description: In this action game written by Jon Williams the player takes the role of Major Blink, the creator of the Berks, who has now become a painter. All blocks must be painted from all sides by the Major while homing drones must be avoided and bears, who try to repaint the blocks, must be shot.

name: Rose & Time
description: Rose is desperate to unravel the mysteries of time travel, so she can rescue her parents who are trapped in the past. One day she feels close to an answer, but must be careful to not cause any paradoxes.

name: Hillbilly Organ Grinder
description: An arcade-style shooter with an Appalachian hillbillies theme.

name: Process
description: An adventure game set in train cars during the 20 minutes prior to a disaster.

name: Cult Master: Ultraman ni Miserarete
description: Players test their knowledge of the Ultraman tokusatsu series in this quiz game.

name: Tirkiss ~Princess Shade~
description: The title character, the sword-wielding Tirkiss, travels to the realm of Irisfied, looking to become a knight who upholds justice and honor. On her way there, she bumps into Princess Margarita, and ends up swearing fealty to her. Little does she know what awaits her as the results of that one humble action...

name: YuYu Hakusho
description: YuYu Hakusho is a fighting game based on the YuYu Hakusho anime. The player can choose from 15 characters, each of which has their own special and hyper moves. The animation for the characters was modeled by the animation studio Pierrot who also did the TV animation.

name: Berks
description: Each territory must be cleared of the mindless Berks using the Terror Tank in this single screen shoot'em up written by Jon Williams.

name: Baby Berks
description: All the Baby Berks have to be destroyed as they hatch from their eggs in this single screen shoot'em up written by Jon Williams.

name: Ninjin: Clash of Carrots
description: Ninjin: Clash of Carrots is an anime-inspired beat-em-up with varied enemies and deep customization. Play as the rabbit Ninjin, or Akai, the ninja fox, and fight to retrieve the carrots stolen by Shogun Moe! Redeem carrots for weapons, upgrades and more! Supports 2-player online or local co-op.

name: Monsterbag
description:
Nia's left her backpack at home and headed out all alone into a world full of danger. But luckily, this is no ordinary backpack. You are V, Nia's monster bag – and it's up to you to keep her safe.

Avoid the violent wrath of angry citizens, bloodthirsty aliens and the inept military, or you'll end up as a pile of monster mush! Catch up to Nia without being seen, oh and… watch out for the apocalypse.

name: Ninku: Tsuyokina Yatsura no Daigekitotsu!
description: A Ninku 2D fighting game.

name: Ninku Dai-ni-Tama: Ninku Sensou-hen
description: The sequel to the original Ninku Game Boy game.

name: Galaxy Trucker
description: Build a spaceship out of a bunch of old junk and attempt to survive encounters with asteroids, slavers and smugglers as you haul cargo across the galaxy.

name: Lets Go Champ
description: An endless running game staring Shannon Briggs, a professional heavyweight boxer.

name: Petrichor
description: Petrichor is the smell of rain. You wander the forest, breathe in the damp air. Eternal rain leaving puddles. You light a fire under a ledge to stay warm. In your pocket is a damp note you found in the mud.

name: Sands of Osiris
description: A standalone remake of the Vampirism mod from Warcraft III with its own map editor and modding capabilities. Built with the JMonkeyEngine.

name: Hamatora: Look at Smoking World
description: Sin descripción

name: Jewel Pet: Mahou de Oshare ni Dance * Deco!
description: Sin descripción

description: A video game based on the 33rd Doraemon film.

name: Zen Fish Simulator
description: A game in which the player controls a fish.

name: Fear Less!
description: A girl’s recurring nightmares of being chased by death. Clear your mind and fight back against the darkness!

name: Empires & Allies
description:
On May 5, 2015, Empires & Allies was revived and re-released as an entirely different mobile game on Apple's App Store and Google Play worldwide. The old Facebook page was repurposed for this game.

8 years later, the title was shutdown on March 31, 2023
